title: ICE when using non-lifetimes in `for<>`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust trait Kind<'a, T> { type This: 'a; } type This<'a, T, K> = >::This; struct X<'a, K: for Kind<'a, T>>; ``` (this is invalid syntax but it shouldn't ICE) ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` 1.62.1 ``` ### Error output ``` error: only lifetime parameters can be used in this context --> src/main.rs:27:21 | 27 | struct X<'a, K: for Kind<'a, T>>; | ^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no entry found for key', compiler/rustc_typeck/src/astconv/mod.rs:2273:29 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no entry found for key', compiler/rustc_typeck/src/astconv/mod.rs:2273:29 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f453adc1fbd - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::h8e036432725b1c57 at /rustc/e092d0b6b43f2de967af0887873151bb1c0b18d3/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:93:5 1: 0x7f453adc1fbd -
